Belgium: Godfrey of Bouillon becomes Duke of Lower Lorraine
Italy: In the Mahdia campaign of 1087, seafaring vessels from the Italian maritime republics of Genoa and Pisa attack the North African town of Mahdia, burning Mahdia's Muslim fleet in the harbour.
Spain: Siege of Tudela: Alfonso the Brave, Sancho Ramírez, Odo I, Duke of Burgundy, the duke of Burgundy, and William the Carpenter, viscount of Melun, laid siege to the Zaragozan fortress at Tudela, Navarre. Sancho Ramírez conquered Estada.
Sweden: Temple at Uppsala, the central place of worship within Ancient Norse paganism, destroyed at order of King Inge the Elder.
